bug.author: conradsnicta
bug.summary: new mlpack website has old download link
bug.description: <denchmark-link:http://mlpack.org>http://mlpack.org</denchmark-link> provides a download link for mlpack 3.1.1, which is outdated; should be 3.2.2 ?

comments.comment: Crap! It was supposed to deploy to a test location during merge. I will have it fixed before I go to bed.
Ok, the link at least seems correct now. I still have to do a pass on the whole site to make sure everything is right, but the biggest issue is fixed for now.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> : I think the links @ <denchmark-link:http://mlpack.org/getstarted.html>http://mlpack.org/getstarted.html</denchmark-link> are still pointnig to the previous mlpack version (MSI/ZIP). Also, the link to github was not updated (<denchmark-link:http://mlpack.org/github.html>http://mlpack.org/github.html</denchmark-link> ) - there is a comment in the MD that says it should get updated during deployment. Looking nice!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gmanlan>@gmanlan</denchmark-link> thanks for pointing that out---fixed now. I can't see any other issues with the deployment, so I'll work on turning the rest of the comment into issues on the mlpack/mlpack.org repository.
